name: telex
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a method of sending written messages down a phone line from one teleprinter to another, the machine that does this, or the message itself: The details were sent by telex. He had been handed a telex about Angelica's missing friend Steve. Compare
teleprinter
More examplesFewer examplesStewart sent an urgent telex to Bucharest.A notice sent by fax, telex, or telepost should reach the organization quickly. He got a job as a telex operator for a City firm.

to send a message down a phone line from one teleprinter to another: [ + two objects ] We telexed him the news at once. I wrote, I phoned, I telexed, but I couldn't reach her.
More examplesFewer examplesIf it were true he would have telexed my hotel.He refused a telexed invitation to attend the conference.By telexing the Science Reference Library in London we could obtain copies of foreign patents within the week.

Add to word list
Add to word list
[ U ] a system for writing messages on a special machine and sending them by phone to another machine of the same kind. This system has now been replaced by fax and email: The money was despatched by telex.
[ C ] a message sent by telex telex verb [ I or T ]
They telexed the office requesting information.
